For any linearly ordered set <math display="inline">\left( X, \le \right)</math> an initial segment is a subset <math display="inline">Y \subseteq X</math> such that whenever <math display="inline">x < y</math> with <math display="inline">y \in Y</math> then <math display="inline">x \in Y</math>.

== Examples ==
* For <math display="inline">\left( \mathbb{R},\le  \right)</math>, and <math display="inline">Y</math> an initial segment, then <math display="inline">Y = \left\{ x \in \mathbb{R}: x < y \right\}</math> or <math display="inline">Y = \left\{ x \in \mathbb{R}: x \le y \right\}</math>
